title: Seeding decay of the false vacuum
authors: Matteo Caneletti and Ian G Moss
abstract:
We present a theory of false vacuum decay induced by spherical nucleation
seeds. The type of seed considered has a boundary characterised by surface
energy terms. The theory applies to false vacuum decay at zero and finite
temperatures. Seeded nucleation may be important for enabling future false
vacuum decay experiments on analogue systems using Bose Einstein Condensates
(BEC). We show that our theory of seeded nucleation at finite temperature
applied to a potassium BEC in two spatial dimensions agrees with numerical,
real-time, simulations.
